abstract: Pew Research Center releases report on 50th anniversary of landmark Immigration and Nationality Act, which eliminated country quotas, highlighting major shifts in immigration since that time; report finds that almost half of 59 million immigrants who have come to United States beginning in 1965 are from Latin America, with arrivals from Asia surpassing those numbers since 2011.
lead_paragraph: A Pew Research Center report revealed major shifts in immigration to the United States since Congress passed the Immigration and Nationality Act a half-century ago.

headline.main: Share of Immigrants in U.S. Nears Highs of Early 20th Century, Report Finds
headline.print_headline: Share of Immigrants in U.S. Nears Highs of Early 20th Century, Report Finds

snippet: A Pew Research Center report revealed major shifts in immigration to the United States since Congress passed the Immigration and Nationality Act a half-century ago.
